item.title: What Is Albedo and Why It Matters
item.description: An easy-to-understand look at albedo, the measure of how much sunlight a surface reflects, and why it plays a key role in climate and planetary science.

media:content.media:title: What Is Albedo and Why It Matters
media:content.media:description: An easy-to-understand look at albedo, the measure of how much sunlight a surface reflects, and why it plays a key role in climate and planetary science.

item.title: Why Does Ice Float on Water?
item.description: A clear explanation of how water molecules form a unique crystal structure when frozen, making ice less dense than liquid water and allowing it to float.

media:content.media:title: Why Does Ice Float on Water?
media:content.media:description: A clear explanation of how water molecules form a unique crystal structure when frozen, making ice less dense than liquid water and allowing it to float.

item.title: Does a Theory of Everything Exist?
item.description: An accessible look at the search for a unified framework that could connect quantum mechanics and gravity, and what physicists mean by a “Theory of Everything.”

media:content.media:title: Does a Theory of Everything Exist?
media:content.media:description: An accessible look at the search for a unified framework that could connect quantum mechanics and gravity, and what physicists mean by a “Theory of Everything.”

item.title: Why Rockets Don’t Launch Straight Up
item.description: Learn why rockets follow curved flight paths instead of going straight up, and how orbital mechanics and Earth’s rotation shape their trajectory into space.

media:content.media:title: Why Rockets Don’t Launch Straight Up
media:content.media:description: Learn why rockets follow curved flight paths instead of going straight up, and how orbital mechanics and Earth’s rotation shape their trajectory into space.

item.title: Invisible Doesn’t Mean Imaginary
item.description: Explore how unseen forces and particles, from gravity to dark matter, shape our universe even when they can’t be observed directly.

media:content.media:title: Invisible Doesn’t Mean Imaginary
media:content.media:description: Explore how unseen forces and particles, from gravity to dark matter, shape our universe even when they can’t be observed directly.

item.title: Why Astrophysicists Debate Lost Information
item.description: An overview of the “information paradox” in black hole research and why scientists continue to study how physical information behaves in extreme cosmic environments.

media:content.media:title: Why Astrophysicists Debate Lost Information
media:content.media:description: An overview of the “information paradox” in black hole research and why scientists continue to study how physical information behaves in extreme cosmic environments.

item.title: Living Inside a Thin Galactic Disk
item.description: Discover how our solar system sits within the thin disk of the Milky Way and what this structure reveals about the formation and evolution of our galaxy.

media:content.media:title: Living Inside a Thin Galactic Disk
media:content.media:description: Discover how our solar system sits within the thin disk of the Milky Way and what this structure reveals about the formation and evolution of our galaxy.

item.title: Exploring Life’s “What If” Questions
item.description: A thoughtful look at the “what if” questions we all consider, and how curiosity can inspire reflection, creativity, and new perspectives.

item.description: Explore the science behind emotional expression and how feelings help us communicate, connect, and navigate everyday life.

item.title: Einstein and Neil deGrasse Tyson Compared
item.description: A thoughtful comparison of Albert Einstein and Neil deGrasse Tyson, looking at their contributions to science, communication, and public understanding of physics.

item.title: The Search for Scientific Answers
item.description: This video explores how scientists ask questions, test ideas, and refine theories, highlighting the process of inquiry that drives discovery and deeper understanding.
